availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Newton Hughey (Crittenden County, Kentucky, Sergeant (U.S.A))

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John R. Hughey and Mary Crider Hughey. Resident of Crittenden County, Kentucky, in 1850. Enlisted as a corporal in 48th Illinois Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) on October 31, 1861. Sergeant in 1864. Promoted to Captain on April 1, 1865. Mustered out of service on August 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, District 1, p. 268A
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Illinois, vol. 3, 1861-1866 (Springfield: Phillips Brothers, 1900), 469.
Find A Grave, "Isaac Newton Hughey (1840-1908)," Memorial #10429019, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10429019 (accessed April 16, 2019).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Illinois, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M539, Roll 0043.
